article: (CNN)"A long, long, time ago..." Those five words, when uttered or sung, makes baby boomers immediately think of Don McLean's pop masterpiece "American Pie."  It's hard to believe that his phenomenal 8½ minute allegory, which millions of Americans know by heart, is 44 years old.  All sorts of histor...
reference:
Manuscript of "American Pie" lyrics is sold to unnamed buyer for $1.2 million .
Douglas Brinkley: The song, a talisman for its age, brings joy to people 44 years later .
summary: Don McLean's "American Pie" sold at Christie's for $1.2 million. The song is a hybrid of modern poetry and folk ballad, beer-hall chant and high-art rock. McLean was a paperboy when he saw that Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens and J.P. "The Big Bopper" Richardson died.

article: (CNN)Their relationship led to jail time for her, but Mary Kay Letourneau Fualaau wants the world to know that she and her husband, Vili Fualaau, are still happily together. She was a married 34-year-old teacher and mother of four in Seattle in 1996 when she began an affair with Fualaau, her 13-year...
reference:
Letourneau Fualaau had a sexual relationship with her student .
He was 13 when they began the relationship in 1996 .
In May, they will celebrate their 10th wedding anniversary .
summary: Mary Kay Letourneau Fualaau and her husband will celebrate their 10th wedding anniversary on May 20. She was a married 34-year-old teacher and mother of four in Seattle in 1996 when she began an affair with her 13- year-old student. She went on to serve more than seven years in prison on charges related to their sexual relationship.

article: (CNN)That's some rich "American Pie." The lyrics to the famed Don McLean song sold for $1.2 million Tuesday morning at an auction held by Christie's. "Don McLean's manuscript of 'American Pie' achieved the 3rd highest auction price for an American literary manuscript, a fitting tribute to one the fo...
reference:
Don McLean's "American Pie" lyrics auctioned for $1.2 million .
The song is dense with symbolism; McLean says lyrics, notes will reveal meaning .
"Pie" is McLean's biggest hit, was No. 1 in 1972 .
summary: Don McLean's "American Pie" manuscript sells for $1.2 million. It's the 3rd highest auction price for an American literary manuscript, Christie's says. The song is one of the most dissected and argued-about songs in the pop music canon. McLean has said that the opening lines were inspired by the death of Buddy Holly.

article: (CNN)You may know Mindy Kaling from Fox's cult hit comedy "The Mindy Project," in which she plays Mindy Lahiri, a perky, quirky OB/GYN juggling her career and love life in New York. (Only in the Big Apple can a doctor not afford an apartment!) The show was a breakthrough for on-screen representation...
reference:
Mindy Kaling's brother Vijay Chokalingam pretended to be black to get into med school .
Jeff Yang: That's offensive and ironic, considering that minorities experience many disadvantages .
summary: Vijay Chokalingam applied to medical school claiming to be African-American. He says he did it to "dramatically improve" his chances of admission. Frida Ghitis: A medical degree isn't a reward to be earned, but a responsibility to be accepted.

article: (CNN)Buzz has surrounded HBO's new documentary "Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief," but Scientologist John Travolta is not a fan. Travolta told the Tampa Bay Times that he has not seen the documentary, "and I don't really care to." "I've been so happy with my (Scientology) experience...
reference:
The actor says he's not planning on seeing the buzzed-about documentary .
He called Scientology "brilliant"
Travolta credits the church with helping him deal with his son's death .
summary: Travolta is one of the Church of Scientology's most high-profile members. The actor is premiering his new film, "The Forger," in Clearwater, Florida. The HBO documentary is based on the book "Going Clear: Scientology, Hollywood, and the Prison of Belief"
